articles.author: Julie Steenhuysen, Caroline Stauffer
articles.description: A new class of weight loss drugs is transforming the U.S. healthcare system in ways that could extend to equally hard-to-treat areas like substance abuse, according to speakers at the Reuters Events Total Health conference in Chicago this week.
articles.title: Weight loss drugs transforming healthcare, may help with addiction -Reuters Events

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian fuel producers have been told by the government to prepare for the scrapping of all remaining restrictions on the export of diesel and gasoline, three industry sources told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russian fuel export ban to be lifted next week

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Thursday will weigh final approval of JPMorgan Chase's (JPM.N) $290 million settlement with women who said Jeffrey Epstein abused them, and that the largest U.S. bank turned a blind eye to the late financier's sex trafficking.
articles.title: US judge to weigh JPMorgan's $290 million settlement with Epstein accusers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell last week as the labor market continued to show few signs of a significant slowdown.
articles.title: US jobless claims fall in latest week in still-strong labor market

articles.author: Karen Freifeld
articles.description: Two U.S. senators plan to introduce a bipartisan bill on Thursday that would require private equity firms to make public how much they invest in China and other countries of concern.
articles.title: US lawmakers to unveil bill requiring private equity firms to reveal China investment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) YouTube and TikTok have been given a Nov. 30 deadline by the European Union to reply to an information request on how they protect children from illegal and harmful content, the European Commission said on Thursday.
articles.title: YouTube, TikTok must detail child protection measures by Nov 30, EU says

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A U.S. judge has blocked the U.S. Department of Justice from pursuing an administrative case accusing Elon Musk's SpaceX of illegally refusing to hire refugees and asylum recipients.
articles.title: SpaceX wins reprieve from US lawsuit alleging anti-immigrant bias

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel
articles.description: Street battles raged in Gaza City with Hamas fighters using tunnels to ambush Israeli forces, as the United States said Palestinians must govern Gaza post-war, countering Israeli comments that it would control security indefinitely.
articles.title: Fierce fighting in Gaza City; US says Palestinians must govern Gaza post-war

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: A defective drone in Iraq may have helped keep America from being dragged deeper into a widening Middle East conflict.
articles.title: US forces under fire in Middle East as America slides towards brink

articles.author: James Oliphant, Joseph Ax
articles.description: For the third time, Donald Trump's rivals for the Republican presidential nomination took to the debate stage on Wednesday night in his absence, seeking a way to dislodge the former president from his commanding lead in opinion polls.
articles.title: Trump's rivals clash at debate but do little to dent his lead
